description: The races for Senate and governor may head to a recount or a runoff.
title: See How Close the Races Are in Florida, Georgia and Arizona
title_page: See How Close the Races Are in Florida, Georgia and Arizona - The New York Times
text: A federal judge on Monday blocked Georgia from certifying its election results before Friday at 5 p.m. Counties were required to submit results to the state by Tuesday, and the acting secretary of state had said she would certify the results on Wednesday. Georgia law requires a runoff in early December if neither candidate receives more than 50 percent of the vote. A recount is triggered if one candidate gets a majority but the margin between the two candidates is less than or equal to 1 percent.
